name: Indian Masala Chicken Wings
author: MICHELLE CHEN
summary: Marinate chicken wings ahead of time in a simple homemade masala paste for an explosion of spicy Indian flavors. Serve with lemon wedges and steamed basmati rice.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon salt, or more as needed
5 large chicken wings, cut in 2, tips discarded
directions: Combine coriander, cumin, cardamom, chile powder, pepper, and cloves in a dry pan over low heat
Remove from heat, add oil and water, and stir until combined
Rub salt over wings in a shallow dish, then rub spice paste all over
Cover and refrigerate, 4 hours to overnight
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate
Add wings and cook, turning halfway, until well browned, 15 to 20 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
